intro: Crossostylis dimera, commonly known as the slender crossostylis, is a herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
